meta.purpose: UI/UX mockup for an individual episode detail page with synopsis, guest cast, and viewing actions
meta.notes_for_model: This is the deepest level of detail - a single episode's full information. It should feel like reading the back of a DVD case for that specific episode, or a detailed TV guide entry. Premium presentation of episode-specific content.

story.one_sentence_brief: An episode detail page featuring an immersive hero with the episode still image, prominent episode number badge, title, runtime and air date, followed by a synopsis section and a horizontal gallery of guest stars with headshots and character names.
story.additional_context: This is where users get all the details about a specific episode before or after watching. It includes the full synopsis, guest cast, and quick actions to mark as watched or navigate to adjacent episodes.

scene.subject: An episode detail page with a hero section (50% viewport) showing an episode still image with gradient overlay. Overlaid content includes a breadcrumb back to the show, an 'S3 E7' badge in gold, the episode title 'The Interview' in large serif typography, meta info (45 min, Jan 15, 2024, Director, Writer), and action buttons. Below is a Synopsis section with the episode description, and a Guest Stars section showing a horizontal row of actor headshots with names and character roles.
secondary_subjects: Breadcrumb navigation '← The Morning Show > Season 3'
Action bar with 'Mark Watched' and streaming provider button
AI Summary card (optional) with teal accent
Guest star cards with 2:3 ratio headshots
scene.action: Static UI mockup showing the complete episode detail page
scene.location: Digital web browser frame showing the episode detail page at desktop resolution
scene.time_of_day: The episode still sets the scene mood
scene.mood: Detailed and informative, like reading a comprehensive episode guide - preparation or reflection on viewing

composition.shot_type: Full page screenshot/mockup view showing the complete episode detail page
composition.framing: Hero section dominates top half with episode still. Synopsis section centered below with comfortable reading width. Guest stars gallery spans full width with horizontal scroll.

style.medium: High-fidelity digital UI design mockup with cinematic imagery
style.era_or_reference: Premium streaming service episode page meets detailed TV Guide entry - comprehensive yet beautifully presented
style.color_palette: Episode still with gradient to deep night (#0D0F14), cinema gold (#D4A853) for episode badge and CTAs, screen teal (#2D8B8B) for AI summary card accent, elevated surface for cards (#1C2230), warm white text, muted cream for secondary

lighting.description: Episode still provides hero lighting with heavy gradient protection for text. Synopsis section on dark background. Guest star headshots have their own professional lighting. Overall interface is dark with content providing visual interest.
lighting.color_and_contrast: High contrast text over gradient-protected hero. Gold badge pops against darker areas. Guest star cards have subtle shadows.

format.surface_or_output: Desktop web browser mockup at 1920x1080 or higher

constraints.factual_accuracy: UI should look functional with proper alignment. Guest star cards should be properly sized (2:3 ratio for headshots). Navigation should be clear.
constraints.safety_and_rights: Use generic/conceptual episode still imagery, not real show content. Guest star faces should be generic silhouettes or artistic representations.
